Better Hotlist Update for Toodledo

Feb 21, 2014
1 minute read

Not long after I published my guide to using Toodledo, I realized something was incomplete with my Better Hotlist: it didn’t take into account tasks that could technically be started on a particular date and have a hard due date.

A great example: what if I have a task that can be started today, but isn’t technically due until next Tuesday? I would want that to show up on the Better Hotlist starting today and stay there until it got done (hopefully on or before the due date).

Fortunately, Toodledo’s Saved Searches are flexible enough to get the job done:

Here’s what each of the conditions does – remember, if a task meets any of these criteria, it will show up:

  • Starred yes: shows any task that I’ve starred (which, [as you might remember][1], indicates a task with no hard deadline that I would like to focus on).
  • Due Date is Today: shows any task that is due today.
  • Due Date is before Today: shows any overdue task.
  • Folder is “No Folder”: shows a task in my “inbox” (i.e., any task I’ve not yet processed).
  • Folder is “4. Waiting/Delegated” and Start Date was not in the last 3 days: shows any task that I’ve delegated and have not heard back on in more than 3 days.
  • Folder is not “4. Waiting/Delegated” and Start Date is after Yesterday: shows any non-delegated task that became actionable yesterday; by my procedure, these tasks will always have due dates.

My continuing goal is to make the Better Hotlist where I spend 90+% of my time in Toodledo; with this small addition, every possible task scenario (that I’ve discovered thus far) is covered in one spot.
